segments.text: I see the woman drying dishes, and I feel bad for her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn’t even know the water is overflowing, and it’s going to ruin everything.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being so sneaky, and she has no idea.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll ever notice what’s happening behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The floor is getting soaked, and she’s just standing there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the boy is going to get hurt, and she won’t even know why.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting for cookies, not caring about the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is so sad—no one is paying attention to what matters.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but feel sorry for her—she’s completely unaware.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone helps her before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR
